vipdopt.optimization.device.Device¶

class vipdopt.optimization.device.Device(size: tuple[int, int, int], permittivity_constraints: tuple[Real, Real], coords: Coordinates, name: str = 'device', init_density: float = 0.5, randomize: bool = False, init_seed: None | int = None, symmetric: bool = False, filters: list[Filter] | None = None, **kwargs)¶

Bases: object

An optical device / object that can be optimized.

Attributes:
size (tuple[int, int]): The (x, y) dimensions of the device

region in voxels.

permittivity_constraints (tuple[Rational, Rational]): Min and max permittivity. coords (Coordinates): The 3D coordinates in space of the device. name (str): Name of the device; defaults to ‘device’. init_density (float): The initial density to use in the device; defaults to 0.5. randomize (bool): Whether to initialize with random values; Defaults to False. init_seed (None | int): The random seed to use when initializing. symmetric (bool): Whether to initialize with symmetric design vairables;

defaults to False. Does nothing if randomize is False.

filters (list[Filter]): Filters to initialize the device with. w (npt.NDArray[np.complex128]): The w variable for the device;

has shape equal to size x (len(filters) + 1).

__init__(size: tuple[int, int, int], permittivity_constraints: tuple[Real, Real], coords: Coordinates, name: str = 'device', init_density: float = 0.5, randomize: bool = False, init_seed: None | int = None, symmetric: bool = False, filters: list[Filter] | None = None, **kwargs)¶

Initialize Device object.

Methods

__init__(size, permittivity_constraints, coords)

Initialize Device object.

as_dict()

Return a dictionary representation of this device, sans self.w.

backpropagate(gradient)

Backpropagate a gradient to be applied to pre-filtered design variables.

binarize(variable_in)

Assumes density - if not, convert explicitly.

compute_binarization(input_variable[, set_point])

Compute what percentage of the device is binarized.

density_to_permittivity(density, eps_min, ...)

Convert density to permittivity.

from_source(source)

Create a new device from a dictionary or load a saved .npy file.

get_density()

Return the density of the device region (i.e. last layer).

get_design_variable()

Return the design variable of the device region (i.e. first layer).

get_permittivity()

Return the permittivity of the design variable.

import_cur_index(import_primitive[, ...])

Reinterpolate and import cur_index into design regions.

index_from_permittivity(permittivity)

Takes square root of permittivty to give the index.

load_dict(device_data)

Load attributes from a dictionary.

load_file(fname)

Load device from a .npz file.

num_filters()

Return the number of filters in this device.

pass_through_filters(x[, binarize])

Pass x through the device filters, returning the output.

permittivity_to_density(eps, eps_min, eps_max)

Convert permittivity to density.

save(fname[, binarize])

Save device to a .npz file.

set_design_variable(value)

Set the first layer of the device region to specified values.

update_density()

Pass each layer of density through the devices filters.

update_filters([epoch])

Update the filters of the device.
as_dict() → dict¶

Return a dictionary representation of this device, sans self.w.

backpropagate(gradient)¶

Backpropagate a gradient to be applied to pre-filtered design variables.

classmethod binarize(variable_in)¶

Assumes density - if not, convert explicitly.

compute_binarization(input_variable, set_point=0.5)¶

Compute what percentage of the device is binarized.

density_to_permittivity(density, eps_min, eps_max)¶

Convert density to permittivity.

classmethod from_source(source: dict | PathLike) → Device¶

Create a new device from a dictionary or load a saved .npy file.

get_density()¶

Return the density of the device region (i.e. last layer).

get_design_variable() → ndarray[Any, dtype[complex128]]¶

Return the design variable of the device region (i.e. first layer).

get_permittivity() → ndarray[Any, dtype[complex128]]¶

Return the permittivity of the design variable.

import_cur_index(import_primitive: Import, reinterpolation_factor: float = 1, reinterpolation_size: tuple[int, int, int] = (300, 300, 306), binarize: bool = False)¶

Reinterpolate and import cur_index into design regions.

Arguments:
import_primitive (Import): The import primitive to import the index to. Will

call import_primitive.set_nk2 with the appropriate values.

reinterpolation_factor (float): The scale factor to use when

reinterpolating. If 1, this function will not perform reinterpolation. Defaults to 1.

reinterpolation_size (tuple[int, int, int]): The number of voxels for the

output when reinterpolating. Defaults to (300, 300, 306).

binarize (bool): Whether to binarize the index before importing. Defaults to

False.

index_from_permittivity(permittivity)¶

Takes square root of permittivty to give the index.

load_dict(device_data: dict)¶

Load attributes from a dictionary.

load_file(fname: Path)¶

Load device from a .npz file.

num_filters()¶

Return the number of filters in this device.

pass_through_filters(x: ndarray[Any, dtype[_ScalarType_co]] | float, binarize=False) → ndarray[Any, dtype[_ScalarType_co]] | float¶

Pass x through the device filters, returning the output.

Does NOT modify the original x, but instead operates on a copy.

Attributes:

x: (npt.NDArray | float): The input density to pass through the filters. binarize (bool): Whether to binarize values.

Returns:

(npt.NDArray | float): The density after passing through filters.

permittivity_to_density(eps, eps_min, eps_max)¶

Convert permittivity to density.

save(fname: Path, binarize: bool = False)¶

Save device to a .npz file.

set_design_variable(value: ndarray[Any, dtype[complex128]])¶

Set the first layer of the device region to specified values.

update_density()¶

Pass each layer of density through the devices filters.

update_filters(epoch=0)¶

Update the filters of the device.
